quest.name: Beasts of the Imperial Wild
journal:
 Quest Sync
Berthellemy in Camp Broken Glass is having a devil of a time trying to keep the stores pest-free.
objectives: Speak with the imperial hunter again.
Wait in the designated location for the almasty, use the spirits on it, defeat it, and obtain a hunk of meat from it.
Deliver the meat to the imperial hunter.

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: Blast it all. Overgrown bastard got away again... If only there were someone we could turn to, but who?

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: Oh, excuse me. Didn't see you there. Pardon my mumbling... Hold a moment. Let me have a look at you. Those eyes, that steady-set jaw... Yes, you're a doughty sort, aren't you? Perfect. You are just the womanman I was in the market for.

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: Our camp's stores are being pillaged, plundered, and altogether despoiled, which is troublesome indeed, as we've so little in the way of provisions as it is. Fortunately, the thieves left tracks, which the Garlean hunters of the area tell us belong to a variety of yeti known as almasty.

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: The wretches are so wily, that once they've found a source of food, they come in droves, telling all their other accursed friends! So that leaves us with only one recourse: swift and bloody retribution.

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: I was told to find the assistance of a master huntswomanhuntsman, but you certainly can't find one of those just lying about. I was fretting over whom to ask, when you fell straight into my lap. And you seem as good a hunter as any, right?

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: If you're willing to cooperate─and I am sure that you are─speak with the imperial hunter just outside camp. He'll set you on the right path.

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: If you're willing to help us curb the depredations of our supplies and teach the almasty a lesson, then speak with the imperial hunter beyond the camp's borders.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: Hold a moment... I know you. Yes, you're one of the Eorzeans who was brought to the station, aren't you!

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: I was told that I would receive assistance from one involved in the contingent's decision-making processes, but I must say...seeing you here comes as a shock. You seem the sort of person as to be above the sniping of vermin. Sure you've the time to spend on such menial tasks?

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: Very well. I won't press the subject any longer. Your assistance will prove invaluable, I'm certain. Now then, time is wasting. Let's reconvene in the Eblan Rime─the almasties' territory─where we'll set the trap.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: This here is the almasties' land, and considering how prolific the things are, we shouldn't have to wait long before one comes lumbering by.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: Ah, but I forget myself. Before we go a-hunting... Here, specialty spirits.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: Not for you, of course. For them─the almasties. Drown them in this stuff and they'll be three sheets to the wind before you know it. There's no easier quarry to catch than a drunk fool, am I right? Also, once you've felled one, don't forget to collect a bloody chunk from it.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: You can't deny that a drunk quarry is much easier to catch than one with its wits about it. That's a lesson I've learned many times over in the taverns I frequent.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: Have you the bloody chunk I requested? I should hope you kept it in a bottle, for I would rather not have gore dripping all over the both of us...

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: Good work. I must say, you've quite the mettle to face such beasts without so much as batting an eyelid. Though, it was silly of me to expect aught else from the selfsame womanman who set foot into Tertium, knowing full well it was a trap.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: You must be wondering why the blood. Well, the almasties are clever creatures─they won't willingly wander into dangerous lands, especially ones that smell of death. So, sprinkling a copious amount of their fellows' gore about the encampment ought to ensure they give us a wide berth.

dialogue.name: GARLEANHUNTER04236
dialogue.text: Let's head back to Camp Broken Glass. There, you can tell the soldier who sent you to me that he was right to put you on the job.

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: The hunter has delivered word to me already of his plans to deal with our yeti troubles. How clever a stratagem he's hit upon. If only the method weren't quite so...macabre, shall we say?

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: Almost surreal to consider that our whilom foes now aid us in our survival.

dialogue.name: BERTHELLEMY
dialogue.text: Today has proven to me that we really can bridge the divide that once separated us from them. And all it takes is for us simply to reach out and offer a hand in friendship. I should like very much were this newfound partnership to continue.
